ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Searched the internet to find agencies and/or services to meet your child's needs?
Talked with other parents about agencies and/or services to meet your child's needs?
Called adult service provider agencies to ask about eligibility and services?
Attended trainings about adult services?
put into writing) your advocacy/communication with agencies and professionals?
Asked questions to professionals about services/eligbility?
Talked with other parents (over the phone) about agencies and/or services to meet their child's needs?
Talked with other parents in person about agencies and/or services to meet their child's needs?
Facilitated trainings or support groups for other families about adult services?
Reviewed the records of another family to help them determine which services they are eligible for?
Helped another family communicate with agencies and professionals?
Visited the office or held meetings with legislators about disability services?
Written letters to legislators about disability services?
Tried to get media attention (e.g., newspaper, television, radio) about disability services?
Taken on leadership roles in national, state, or local agencies related to disability services?
Presented at state or national conferences about disability services?
Timepoint/visit label
